intro: Erycibe longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed erycibe, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically orange or red when mature, containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
